article.headline: Providence 80, Fairfield 72
article.story: BRIDGEPORT, Conn. -- Vincent Council, Bryce Cotton, and Gerald Coleman combined for 67 points as Providence beat Fairfield 80-72 on Monday night. Council finished with a game-high 26 points, including 19 in the second half and Cotton poured in a career-high 24 points. Coleman chipped in with 17 points off the bench. In the second half, the Stags (1-1) opened with a 7-4 run to extend their lead to 37-33 behind a three pointer by Ryan Olander. The Friars responded with a 12-0 run led by Council and Cotton, who each scored six to give the Friars (2-0) a 47-37 lead. The Stags answered with a 10-0 run to tie the game, 47-47. The tie was short lived as Council scored six straight points to lead the Friars on another run. Providence remained strong down the stretch, hitting critical free throws and outscoring Fairfield 51-42 in the second half.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
